neighbors.name: Mildred R Tandy
neighbors.claims: Mildred Rodgers Tandy was a resident of Princeton, Caldwell County, who passed away on June 22, 2023, in Marietta, Georgia [Carmichael Funeral Homes](https://www.carmichaelfuneralhomes.com/obituaries/Mildred-Tandy?obId=28299642). She is buried at Eddy Creek Church Cemetery in Caldwell County [Carmichael Funeral Homes](https://www.carmichaelfuneralhomes.com/obituaries/Mildred-Tandy?obId=28299642). The property is likely currently held by her estate; she was survived by her daughter, Karen Tandy Priest, and son-in-law Michael Joseph Quilling [Carmichael Funeral Homes](https://www.carmichaelfuneralhomes.com/obituaries/Mildred-Tandy?obId=28299642). The Tandy family name has longstanding roots in the area, evidenced by local geography such as Tandy Road [Zillow](https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/Tandy-Rd-Princeton-KY-42445/306506788_zpid/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Owner is deceased (2023); property likely in estate

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact the estate executor or next of kin (Karen Tandy Priest). Approach with condolences and respect for the family's historical connection to the land.

neighbors.name: Pennyrile Rural Electric Cooperative (R.E.A.)
neighbors.claims: The owner listed as 'R E A' refers to the Rural Electric Administration, known locally as the Pennyrile Rural Electric Cooperative Corporation [Pennyrile Electric](https://www.precc.com/https-www-precc-com-wp-content-uploads-2025-11-bylaws-october-2025-pdf/). Pennyrile Rural Electric has served Caldwell County since the 1940s, with electrical lines extended to the area in 1945 [Historical Marker Database](https://trigghistory.org/highway-markers/). The cooperative maintains active infrastructure easements and construction projects in the region [KY Transportation Cabinet](https://transportation.ky.gov/Construction-Procurement/Proposals/200-CHRISTIAN-11-1024.pdf). This parcel is likely a utility substation or easement rather than a residential property.

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate via technical utility interconnection channels rather than community outreach. This is an infrastructure partner, not a residential stakeholder.

citations.claim: The owner listed as 'R E A' refers to the Rural Electric Administration, known locally as the Pennyrile Rural Electric Cooperative Corporation
citations.title: Pennyrile Rural Electric Cooperative Bylaws

citations.title: Historical Markers - Pennyrile REA

citations.claim: The cooperative maintains active infrastructure easements and construction projects in the region
citations.title: KY Transportation Cabinet Proposal - Pennyrile Rural Electric

neighbors.name: Dana K Hartigan
neighbors.claims: Dana K. Hartigan is a member of a long-standing agricultural family in Caldwell County; he is the son of the late Earl H. Hartigan (died 2011) and Leta Hartigan [Lakeland Funeral Home](https://www.lakelandchapel.com/obituaries/Earl-H-Hartigan?obId=1104125). The Hartigan family has a multigenerational farming presence in the Princeton area, and Dana's uncle, Robert Hartigan, was also a prominent local farmer until his passing in 2014 [Morgan's Funeral Home](https://www.lakelandchapel.com/obituaries/Robert-Hartigan?obId=1104047). Dana Hartigan is listed as a resident of Caldwell County alongside his wife, Denice [Lakeland Funeral Home](https://www.lakelandchapel.com/obituaries/Earl-H-Hartigan?obId=1104125).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via trusted agricultural community members (e.g., Farm Bureau) familiar to the family. Acknowledge the family's farming history established by his father Earl and uncle Robert.

citations.claim: Dana K. Hartigan is a member of a long-standing agricultural family in Caldwell County; he is the son of the late Earl H. Hartigan (died 2011) and Leta Hartigan
citations.title: Earl H. Hartigan Obituary
